RECORDS.NAME: N7IPY
RECORDS.DESCRIPTION: This Ground Station Operated from a Raspberry Pi-3B  and a SDRplay.  The Antennas are all M2 Antenna Systems; 14 Element RH Pol VHF, 30 Element RH Pol UHF and 22 Element Horizontal Pol at 1.2GHz with Preamp.  The Rotor System is an Upgraded full digital G-5500.  The property is on a slight decline and the antenna location is south of the main house, signals are blocked to 30 degrees to the North-West.  The feed line is 75 Feet x 3 of LMR400 with Triplexer at the SDRPlay.

RECORDS.NAME: W8TAU's original (very) humble station
RECORDS.DESCRIPTION:
(Offline indefinitely as of 2020-07-18)
Very rudimentary indoors RTL-SDR setup for testing. RTL-SDR v3 kit antenna from the RTL-SDR blog taped up on an interior wall near the ceiling oriented with one leg pointing due North and the other due South.

Started (2020-05-02) with the large antenna elements fully extended to get a baseline. Shortened elements for a better resonance on target frequencies (~2020-05-08T04:20z).

Kit: https://www.rtl-sdr.com/using-our-new-dipole-antenna-kit/

RECORDS.DESCRIPTION:
This station is a solar-powered raspberry pi, with a V-Dipole antenna, which may be relocated, and provided with a 3G/LTE data connection, for an even lower noise floor.  This station is also not close to any major towns or cities, meaning low interference. Future upgrades include 

-Adding A LNA
-Adding an FM Bandpass filter (We have some nearby FM Stations that transmit at high power levels)
-And a better power system that runs on lithium batteries instead of lead acid

RECORDS.NAME: Dru VFH
RECORDS.DESCRIPTION: 3 Dec 19 changed from HF Dipole to homemade quadrifilar helix antenna. Wood, 12 gauge copper wire with insulation on and hot glue. Many tries, even having a NanoVNA; tuned for 146 Mhz; symmetrical lengths; 0.41 w/h ratio; quarter wave RHCP insert. Antenna, RTL-SDR, Pi4. Improved with obs 1315448 after adding 3 loops in ferrite core choke and turning left 90 deg; slightly lowered freq. Now better at times than my other ground plane. On table next to house under large cottonwood (no leaves).

RECORDS.DESCRIPTION:
[IN TESTING] This station is basically the worst possible Satnogs station you can build - thrown together with limited parts. Omnidirectional UHF ruler dipole (not actually an eggbeater - I chose the closest option) station built out of extremely limited parts. Anti-waterproof. Not permanently on due to the present lack of durability in the design. 



I don't expect it to have good reception but I expect it to detect CW and see (but not decode) 9k6 FSK beacons.


RTL-SDR v3
Pi Zero W

The station is currently equipped with an auto scheduler that runs every 15 minutes to fill roughly the next 15 minutes. NOTE: Because of where we are in Utah Valley, observations of satellites east of the station may be blocked by the mountains if their passes are too low to the horizon.

Satnogs computer is a Core i5 4300U fanless mini PC with 4gb ram 512gb ssd.  The rotator is PELCO PT570P converted to stepper motors and the k3ng rotator controller, and is at this point, still a work in progress.  SDR is PlutoSDR.
